question.text: Observe the labeling in the diagram and identify A and B

options.text:
A-Corticular nephrons (65-50% of total nephrons)
B-Juxtaglomerular neurons (35-50% of total nephrons)

A-Juxtaglomerular nephrons (85-90% of total nephrons)
​B-Corticular nephrons (10-15% of total nephrons)

A-Corticular nephrons (80-85% of total nephrons)
B-Juxtaglomerular neurons (15-20% of total nephrons)

A-Corticular nephrons (25-30% of total nephrons)
B-Juxtaglomerular neurons (75-80% of total nephrons)

solution.text: The human kidney has about 85% cortical nephrons and about 15% juxta-medullary nephrons. The cortical neurons are highly coiled structures with major parts present in the cortex region. Juxta-medullary nephrons have a long loop of Henle which runs deep in the medulla, well developed Vasa recta, and are mainly activated during a shortage of water.
